meanings.definition: A former British coin worth one twentieth of a pound.
meanings.sent1: In the past, a shilling could buy a lot of sweets.
meanings.sent2: I found an old shilling from my great-grandfather's collection.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penny go to school? To become a shilling!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a shiny shilling in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the shilling dropping into the jar echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda, equal to one hundredth of a pound.
meanings.sent1: She exchanged her dollars for shillings before the trip.
meanings.sent2: The market vendor quoted the price in shillings per kilogram.
meanings.sent3: Why did the elephant bring a suitcase full of shillings to the party? To have trunkloads of fun!
meanings.sent4: The idea of time as shillings slipping through his fingers haunted him.
meanings.sent5: The colorful shillings in the street market made it look like a vibrant painting.
